item.title: The Witcher 3: The 28 Best Silver Swords, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Silver swords in The Witcher 3 are essential for slaying creatures, while steel swords are best for human enemies.
  • By utilizing the right silver sword for the job, players can easily tackle tough creatures without breaking a sweat.
  • The variety of silver swords available in the game offer unique boosts and abilities, allowing players to tailor their weapon to their play style.

Of all the weapons players use in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt perhaps most useful are the silver swords. These weapons are intended for the slaying of mythical, mystical, and magical beasts. While steel swords will carve through human enemies, silver swords will cut down any fearsome creature of legend. These two swords are the bread and butter of a witcher's trade, and no self-respecting monster slayer would travel without covering all their bases.

There are a lot of silver swords to choose from, and the best option will vary depending on playstyle and enemies. For general use, however, players should strongly consider the best silver swords in The Witcher 3 to fulfill their contracts. Without these swords at the player's disposal, high-level monsters will cut Geralt into ribbons because of how ineffective his blade is.

Updated on December 27, 2024, by Gerardo Molina: The concept of silver swords being necessary to hunt down monsters is very interesting. And while silver weapons and monster-hunting isn’t something that The Witcher invented, this universe did perfect the concept. As they progress through the base game and the two DLCs available, players will be able to come across various side quests that will reward them with great silver swords that can give them an advantage in difficult battles. Although some have really high base damage, others trade a bit of that for better status effects or additional critical hit bonuses. At the end of the day, the best silver sword will be greatly determined by players’ playstyle and build.

28 An’ferthe

Great Critical Hit Damage Bonus

  • 319-391 Damage
  • +50% Critical Hit Damage Bonus
  • 2 random Magic effects

Like a few other silver swords in the game, An’ferthe can either be found as random loot or purchased from various merchants throughout Novigrad, Oxford, and Skellige. This weapon features outstanding critical hit damage bonus and some other very interesting effects that make it an all-around great choice for slaying monsters.

If players don't want to look around for this weapon, one of the easiest ways to get it is to complete the “Of Swords and Dumplings” quest in Novigrad, purchase An’ferthe’s diagram from Hattori and have him craft it with the right ingredients (2x Leather Scraps, 2x Meteorite Silver Ingots, 2x vials of Monster Blood).

27 Addan Deith

Outstanding Base Damage

  • 810-990 Damage
  • +30% Bleed
  • +4 Damage Dealt To Wraiths
  • Adrenaline Generation On Hitting Foe +2
  • Chance Of Instant Kill +2%

Addan Deith is arguably one of the best silver swords in the entirety of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt . Not only does it have very high base damage, but it also adds a 30% Bleed status effect increase and deals an extra 4% damage to wraiths. At the higher character levels, players can expect to do upwards of 800 points of damage, which is formidable.

This weapon can be obtained from a chest during “The Gargoyle Contract” and, since it’s an all-around powerhouse, every player should swing it at least once.

26 Bloodsword

Complete The Quest 'Inheritance'

  • 310-380 Damage
  • 5-20% Critical Hit Damage
  • 1-4% Critical Hit Chance
  • 9% Bleed
  • 1-2 % Dismember

Found as hidden treasure in Boxholm, the Bloodsword is a solid choice for taking down tough beasts or if under-leveled for the challenge ahead. It deals 227 to 277 damage every hit and raises critical hit damage and the chance of landing a critical.

But the sword’s main benefit is the added chance of causing bleeding and dismemberment. Bleed will deal damage over time, making foes fall faster, and dismemberment is always helpful. It’s a great sword that can be used to attack a few times until the bleed effect kicks in. Geralt can then back off and play defensively while the bleeding does its work.

25 Naevde Seidhe

In The Ancient Ruins Under The Mountains Of Ard Skellig

  • 363-443 Damage
  • 8-15% Igni Sign Intensity
  • 8-15% Yrden Sign Intensity
  • 10% Stagger

There are three ways to obtain this sword. The first is by finding it in a Monster’s Den in Kaer Gelen near the Miner’s Camp. The second is by completing the quest "For Fame And Glory." Finally, players can find one in the Ancient Crypt at Ard Skellig.

It’s the ideal sword for players that rely heavily upon signs as it boosts the intensity of Igni and Yrden signs. It also has a chance of causing stagger, which can be useful for getting some distance to cast signs or retreat if need be.

24 Manticore Silver Sword

Craftable Weapon Introduced In Blood & Wine

  • 335 – 409 Damage
  • 250 Armor Piercing
  • 50% Critical Damage
  • 5% Critical Hit Chance
  • 10% Bleed
  • +5% Experience From Humans/Nonhumans

The Manticore Silver Sword is obtained from a diagram hidden in a cave beneath the Palace Gardens. It’s guarded by gas and a mysterious stranger, but it’s worth the effort. The sword comes with some powerful stats.

It comes short of the Grandmaster gear from other schools, but it is more than capable of doing the job. The armor-piercing combined with bleed makes it ideal for tough targets. The experience gain bonus is also handy when facing humans and nonhumans alike.

23 Sarrim

Craftable Weapon Introduced In Hearts Of Stone

  • 418 – 512 Damage
  • 15% Aard Sign Intensity
  • 15% Igni Sign Intensity
  • 15% Axii Sign Intensity
  • 75% Critical Hit Damage
  • 10% Critical Hit Chance

To wield the mighty Sarrim, players must find its diagram located at a bandit camp in the Kilkerinn Ruins. The sword provides a number of boosts in addition to great damage.

This puts the Sarrim ahead of many of the Mastercrafted Witcher school silver swords in terms of raw damage output. The Sign intensity perks are helpful for just about any build, and the almost doubled Critical Hit Damage is nice. It is certainly one of the best silver swords in The Witcher 3 .

22 Harpy

Random Loot In The Caves Of Velen And Skellige

  • 427 – 523 Damage
  • 14% Bleed

The Harpy sword is very simple compared to others on this list, but that simplicity is one of its greatest strengths. It has an incredible base damage of 427, making it a powerful sword on that fact alone and capable of tackling most foes in the game.

But it also has the benefit of providing a 14% chance of causing Bleed. A dozen or so swings, and if the enemy is still standing, they have a good chance of being inflicted with Bleed, which will siphon off the last of their health points. This sword is great for long, brutal fights with tough foes. The Harpy sword can be found at a bandit camp near the Bloody Baron's compound.

21 Dahlia (Relic)

Looted From The Slyzard Matriarch In "Contract: Bovine Blues"

  • 441 – 539 Damage
  • +150 Armor piercing
  • +20% Igni Sign intensity
  • +50% Critical hit damage bonus
  • +10% Critical hit chance
  • +10% Chance to poison

The Slyzard Matriarch is one of the most powerful monsters in Blood & Wine , which is par for the course in a DLC that ramps up the challenge significantly. Players must bring their A-game and use a combination of signs, oils, potions, bombs, and sword attacks to take down this foe. This is far from easy, but players who have mastered the combat skills will be able to make quick work of this dreadful foe.

Not only will players stop the villagers' cows from being devoured, but they can also loot the powerful Dahlia from this monster's corpse. It's a great sword that enhances Geralt's Igni, enhances his critical hit effectiveness, and can also poison foes. It's one of the best silver swords in The Witcher 3 that is perfect for players who love debilitating their foes by any means necessary.

20 Fen'aeth (Craftable)

A Craftable Sword Featured In Blood & Wine

  • 454 – 554 Damage
  • +26% Aard Sign intensity
  • +85% Critical hit damage bonus
  • +11% Critical hit chance
  • +15% Chance to poison
  • +5% Bonus experience from monsters

It's only a given that the last DLC to come for The Witcher 3 features some of the strongest equipment in the game that players can get their hands on. This can become a necessity in certain cases because of the high difficulty of the many monsters players can encounter in the region of Toussaint, making it important for players to have the best silver swords in The Witcher 3 at their disposal to make quick work of these challenging enemies.

With a crafting recipe, players can form Fen'aeth, a silver blade that's no joke. Players who love using Aard and want their critical hits to land for serious damage should prioritize crafting this weapon the moment they hit Level 39.

19 Gesheft (Land Of A Thousand Fables)

Follow A Will O' The Wisp After Defeating The Cloud Giant

  • 459 – 561 Damage
  • +20% Aard Sign intensity
  • +20% Igni Sign intensity
  • +20% Quen Sign intensity
  • +20% Yrden Sign intensity
  • +20% Axii Sign intensity

The Land of a Thousand Fables is one of the most beautiful locations players can find in the entire game, showing off Blood & Wine 's many strengths. Players can get whisked onto a wild adventure that features some dark twists on popular fairytales, with this world being a safe space for Syanna. Geralt finds her in this magical realm, and they encounter a Cloud Giant during their adventures here.

Players who follow a Will o' the wisp right after this giant is done away with will find the Gesheft. This sword is obtained as a part of an elaborate Dark Souls reference coupled with a bonfire and enhances the intensity of Geralt's Signs, making it one of the best silver swords in The Witcher 3 .

18 Casus Foederis

Behind An Illusory Wall In Regis' Makeshift Abode At The Cemetery

  • 460 – 562 Damage
  • +150 Armor piercing
  • +15% Aard Sign intensity
  • +15% Quen Sign intensity
  • +50% Critical hit damage bonus
  • +15% Critical hit chance

Blood & Wine serves as Geralt's final adventure in The Witcher 3 , making it clear why the bulk of the loot found in Toussaint is so powerful. Players can find a wealth of powerful armaments that Geralt can use to slice monsters apart, with one such weapon found in Regis' makeshift home in a cemetery that Geralt stumbles upon during the main questline.

With The Eye of Nehaleni, Geralt can uncover an illusory wall here that houses Casus Foederis, a powerful silver sword. Giving a bonus to armor piercing, critical hits, and both Aard & Quen, it's easy to see why this sword is perfect for players who combine magic with their melee attacks on a frequent basis.

17 Viper Venomous Silver Sword

Found In Gaunter's World

  • 463 – 565 Damage
  • 25% Aard Sign Intensity
  • 75% Critical Hit Damage
  • 10% Critical Hit Chance
  • 15% Chance to Poison
  • 20% Experience from Monsters

Added in the Hearts of Stone DLC, this sword is only obtainable if the player chooses to help Olgierd, rather than simply allowing Gaunter O'Dimm to collect his debt. The sword is in the riddle, along the left of the path, lit up by a red light.

With high critical damage and decent damage over time, this weapon is a great choice for players wishing to tackle the harder content in the game or those who wish to roleplay as a Witcher who uses a lot of poisons.

16 Grandmaster Forgotten Wolven Silver Sword

Craftable Weapon In The Next-Gen Update (Patch 4.0)

  • 472 – 576 Damage
  • 10% Sign Intensity
  • 7% Adrenaline Point Gain
  • 35% Critical Hit Damage
  • 15% Critical Hit Chance
  • 10% Chance to Cause Bleeding
  • 10% Experience from Monsters

Added in the Next Gen Update for The Witcher 3 , the Forgotten Wolven set is based on the armor worn by Geralt in the Netflix show. It can first be found through the "In the Eternal Fire's Shadow" quest in Velen. This will grant the player the base diagrams, but these are nowhere near as strong as the Grandmaster versions. To craft the Grandmaster set, players will need to complete the scavenger hunt for some notes in Kaer Morhen. They can then pay Yoana in Crow's Perch to make the Mastercrafted armor and Hattori in Novigrad to make the Mastercrafted swords. Finally, with these items, Lazare Lafargue in Toussaint can craft the Grandmaster set.

This Grandmaster silver sword is not the strongest in the game as none of its benefits are massive, but it does provide a mix of bonuses that can help builds with sign damage, adrenaline gain, and damage over time.

15 Grandmaster Griffin Silver Sword

Part Of The Griffin School Gear

  • 472 – 576 Damage
  • 21% Sign Intensity
  • 5% Critical Hit Chance
  • 25% Critical Damage
  • 10% Dismemberment
  • 20% Experience From Monsters

This is the first Witcher set the player is likely to encounter in the game. It is very powerful, even if it is the weakest of the four sets. The diagrams are in Kaer at Ard Skellig.

It can be obtained in its weakest form early on and upgraded, making it a solid sword from the early parts of the game until mid to late game. As with the Forgotten Wolven Set, it must be mastercrafted first and then taken to the Toussaint, where its final form can be crafted. The Grandmaster variant boasts static damage of 576 with a critical hit damage bonus, an experience gain bonus against monsters, and a boost to sign intensity.

14 Grandmaster Feline Silver Sword

Part Of The Cat School Gear

  • 472 – 576 Damage
  • 15% Aard Sign Intensity
  • 10% Critical Hit Chance
  • 15% Bleed
  • 10% Dismemberment
  • 20% Bonus Experience From Monsters

Like the Griffin sword, the Feline silver sword can be obtained early and enhanced over time to be a powerful weapon. Its diagram is found in the ruins of Est Tayiar behind a secret wall. The Grandmaster variant deals the same 476 damage as the Griffin.

It also has a chance to cause bleeding, increases Aard sign intensity, and grants experience gains from monsters. Instead of relying on criticals for occasional spurts of damage, it gives steady results with bleeding and improved Aard damage.

13 Grandmaster Ursine Silver Sword

Part Of The Bear School Gear

  • 472 – 576 Damage
  • 21% Adrenaline Point Gain
  • 75% Critical Hit Damage
  • 5% Critical Hit Chance
  • 14% Dismemberment
  • 20% Bonus Experience From Monsters

One of the strongest of the four Witcher sets, the Ursine silver sword provides great damage and helpful abilities. Its diagram is located on a small island near Olean's Grove. The Grandmaster variant deals 472 - 576 damage.

Where this weapon shines is in the perks. It grants a boost to critical hit chance, a 10% chance at dismemberment, an incredibly useful 20% boost to monster experience gain, and the piece de resistance is a boost to Adrenaline gain. The longer a fight goes with this sword, the more likely Geralt is to kill them with one blow. As with all the Wolven sets, it must be upgraded steadily through NPCs such as Hattori and Lazare Lafargue.

12 Grandmaster Wolven Silver Sword

Part Of The Wolf School Gear

  • 472 – 576 Damage
  • 11% Sign Intensity
  • 11% Adrenaline Gain
  • 11% Critical Hit Chance
  • 10% Bleed
  • 5% Bonus Experience From Humans/Nonhumans

The strongest of the Witcher sets is the Wolven. It’s only available with the DLC and is found inside the Termes Palace near Beauclair. It is an improvement over its Forgotten variant.

It has a boost to sign intensity, gives a boost to Adrenaline gain, and provides the familiar boost to monster experience point gain. Setting it apart from the others is a chance to cause bleeding. It’s the other Witcher sets wrapped into one with a nice bonus on top.

11 Tah’rel

Craftable Weapon Introduced In Blood & Wine

  • 481 – 587 Damage
  • 28% Aard Sign Intensity
  • 95% Critical Hit Damage
  • 12% Critical Hit Chance
  • 15% Poison
  • +5% Experience From Monsters

The Tah’rel diagram can be a bit tricky to find, but it is worth it to get a powerful silver sword. It’s in the large river south of The Silver Salamander Inn to the west of the first major fork in the road. It's part of the "What Was That About Again" quest. Once crafted, players will have a strong sword with a number of helpful stats.

With lots of damage and an almost doubled critical hit damage, this sword is capable of packing quite the punch. The bonus experience from monsters is also a nice touch and cuts down on some of the end-game grinding needed for higher levels.

10 Grandmaster Legendary Griffin Silver Sword

Part Of The Griffin School Gear, Introduced In Blood & Wine

  • 481-587 Damage
  • +25% Sign intensity
  • +50% Critical hit damage bonus
  • +10% Critical hit chance
  • +10% Chance to dismember
  • +20% Bonus experience from monsters

Blood & Wine introduced Grandmaster Gear, which players could strive to acquire, letting them enjoy the best versions of every school's armor set. This was a welcome inclusion, especially since most players were disappointed that even mastercrafted armor lost its relevance after a point.

The Griffin School has pretty cool-looking armor that players upgrade to Grandmaster level. The legendary variant of the silver sword can also achieve this upgrade. The bonus to Sign intensity and multiple critical hit buffs make combat with this weapon incredibly satisfying.

9 Grandmaster Legendary Ursine Silver Sword

Part Of The Bear School Gear, Introduced In Blood & Wine

  • 481-587 Damage
  • +25% Adrenaline Point gain
  • +100% Critical hit damage bonus
  • +5% Critical hit chance
  • +14% Chance to dismember
  • +20% Bonus experience from monsters

The School of the Bear is one of the more fascinating schools in the game, with its heavy armor set providing greater defenses at the cost of lower speed. The outfit looks great, and players will love how the silver sword of the set promotes an aggressive playstyle.

Players who love using their Adrenaline Points in battle will adore how quickly they're generated with this legendary sword. It's a great feeling for players to show monsters who are boss, using a combination of Signs and powerful blows to take them down in a jiffy.

item.title: 10 Best Military Horror Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Horror games explore diverse themes like survival, military conflict, and paranormal threats in immersive settings.
  • Resident Evil, F.E.A.R., and Metro 2033 are standout military horror games known for their thrilling action and gripping narratives.
  • From tackling underground labs to stopping rogue experiments, these games offer a mix of psychological horror and unsettling gameplay.

Horror has long proved to be one of the most popular genres for exploring important topics, including PTSD, guilt, grief, and abuse, to name a few. Horror games urge players to confront their fears, and in a world of conflict and nuclear threat, military scenarios are becoming increasingly popular backdrops.

Likewise, many gamers simply prefer the action aspect of horror in more grounded scenarios, rather than the slow, creeping stealth elements that many games in the genre employ. From tactical take-down operations to guns-blazing frontline combat, these are some of the best military horror games that delve into past, present, future, and fictional conflicts.

10 Resident Evil: Operation Raccoon City

Infiltrate An Underground Lab To Expose Umbrella

The Resident Evil franchise has produced some of the best survival horror games of all time. One of the less-discussed titles, however, is Operation Raccoon City. Although deviating both style and canon-wise from other entries in the series, it still stands as an interesting spin-off.

In Resident Evil: Operation Raccoon City, players can run through the Umbrella Security campaign to prevent research on the T-virus from reaching the US military, or the Spec Ops campaign, where they are investigating the cause of the outbreak. Either way, there are plenty of undead action-packed scares to be had.

9 Return To Castle Wolfenstein

A WWII FPS But Make It Paranormal

  • Developer: Gray Matter Studios
  • Publisher: Activision

World War 2 has inspired a number of re-imagined horror narratives in fictional media, with video games being no exception. Return to Castle Wolfenstein has the player take on the role of William Blazkowicz, an Army Ranger assigned to investigate the movements of Germany's "Paranormal Division."

The deeper into the game the player gets, the darker the secrets they will uncover while encountering dangerous soldiers and unnatural creatures along the way. Return to Castle Wolfenstein set the standard for 3D first-person shooters, particularly in the horror genre, with its incorporation of military roleplay.

8 F.E.A.R.

Put A Stop To Rogue Military Experiments

F.E.A.R. — or "First Encounter Assault Recon" — is an army unit tasked with protecting the United States from paranormal dangers. The player controls a Sergeant known only as "Point Man" on a mission to shut down the covert military company Armacham Technology Corporation.

As the ATC's disturbing and unethical experiments come to light, the player will begin to wonder what is real and who to trust. An interesting take on psychological horror, F.E.A.R. is definitely worth a play for horror FPS fans, or for those who enjoy narratives that explore the risks of biotechnology.

7 State Of Decay: Lifeline

An Open World Zombie Shooter

State of Decay is a third-person zombie survival horror game. The player must navigate a zombie-ridden world, surviving by base-building, fighting, and scavenging. In the story mode, they must additionally determine the motives of the military's presence in the valley.

The DLC Lifeline allows players to play from the point of view of the military, with new playable characters, maps, and weapons. For an open-world game, State of Decay has some genuinely terrifying moments and zombie designs, despite its occasional jankiness.

6 Sepc Ops: The Line

Will Leave Players Horrified Even After They've Stopped Playing

When discussing horror games, it is easy to think of traditional gimmicks like spooky ghosts and evil demons. However, a game does not necessarily need all of these elements; its context alone is enough to evoke that same sense of dread and unease. Spec Ops: The Line , is one such game.

Set in present-day and sandstorm-decimated Dubai, the player is tasked with carrying out recon to locate any survivors. The horror in The Line comes from the storytelling, as the player is forced to make horrific moral decisions that are never rewarded. While on the surface this is a standard military shooter, it is also a haunting psychological horror that explores the dark realities of war.

5 Amnesia: The Bunker

Uncover The Dark Secrets Of A WW1 Bunker

The Amnesia franchise is well known for taking players on atmospheric journeys through psychological horror narratives. Amnesia: The Bunker is the fifth entry, following French soldier Henri trying to escape a sealed-up WW1 bunker.

As the player explores, they will discover the truth about the bunker's origins, and about what horrors really lurk in the darkness. Unlike other Amnesia games, The Bunker has a degree of combat and leaves behind the sanity mechanic. That being said, this is still a hair-raising game that requires both courage and resourcefulness to complete.

4 System Shock 2

An Isolating Survival Horror Sequel

A sequel to the original 1994 title, System Shock 2 throws the player into the shoes of a member of the military group "Unified National Nominate." Awakening from a cryogenic sleep on the Von Braun , they must explore the spaceship and destroy mutant aliens while uncovering the disturbing fate of the rest of the crew via audio logs.

System Shock 2 incorporates various types of gameplay, including character customization, combat, and survival horror (such as inventory management). With a horribly tense atmosphere, this is a must-play for fans of horror games set in space.

3 S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart Of Chornobyl

Encounter Disturbing Mutations As A Marine Veteran

In S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl , the player takes control of Ukrainian marine, Skif, who finds his home destroyed by a rogue anomaly after returning from war. To earn money in order to afford a new place to live, he ventures into the nuclear disaster site called "The Zone" to find valuable artifacts.

Not only must players face disturbing, mutated creatures in The Zone, they must also face hostile factions, including the International Perimeter Security Force — a branch of the Ukrainian military acting as border control to The Zone. One of many horror games loosely based on real events, Heart of Chornobyl is extra scary because of its not-so-impossible events.

2 Metro 2033: Redux

An Atmospheric Portrayal Of The Post-Apocalypse

Metro 2033 takes place in a post-apocalyptic Moscow 20 years after a catastrophic nuclear war. With the above ground being dangerously irradiated and stalked by deadly mutants, survivors are forced to take refuge in the underground metro system.

Amid a torn political landscape — divided between Stalinists and Nazis — the player must venture beyond the metro, navigating environmental and human threats to save what is left of humanity. Metro 2033 has an unnerving dystopian atmosphere, balancing combat and tension building for a truly frightening experience.

1 The Dark Pictures Anthology: House Of Ashes

Escape An Ancient Temple And The Dangers Lurking Within

House of Ashes is the third game in the interactive horror series The Dark Pictures Anthology . The game follows five playable characters, all members of the armed forces, who have fallen into an underground temple while planning a raid. The player will gradually uncover the history of the temple, and the fate of those who preceded them.

House of Ashes excels at interweaving plots, focusing not just on the overarching conflict and survival, but also on the characters' relationships with each other and their personal struggles. The player's decisions throughout the game influence the way the story progresses, including whether the characters survive and which ending they get. Overall, this is a great military horror for players who prefer narrative-driven games.

item.title: Stalker 2: On The Edge Walkthrough
item.description:
After completing the main mission at the SIRCAA facility in Stalker 2 , players may have noticed that Zalissya is no longer on the list of places you can fast-travel through a guide. This may seem like a bug, but you must head out on foot to uncover what's going on in Zalissya. After getting near the base, you'll receive a transmission from Gaffer asking for help to defend Zalissya against the Monolith attack. This will start the On the Edge mission, which involves saving Zalissya and getting operational by helping out resident stalkers.

Defending Zalissya from Monolith Invasion

After reaching Zalissya, you'll notice that the base is in ruins and a bunch of Monolithian soldiers are attacking everyone there. First, you'll need to head into the base and clear out all the attacking Monolith soldiers.

Make sure to only fire at Monolith soldiers and not attack stalkers defending Zalissya. You can double-check if your cursor stays white or turns green when aiming at soldiers before pulling the trigger. If you shoot a soldier defending Zalissya more than once, it will fail the entire mission and the settlement will fall.

Once you're done clearing out Monolith soldiers, head inside the Ward building and talk to Gaffer sitting inside to start the On the Edge side quest. He'll ask you to track down Uncle Lyonya, who was a Monolithian, and take him down.

How to Find Warlock's Weapon (Optional)

Talking to Warlock, he'll explain how there are two objectives Skif needs to complete for him to get things back on track. The first of the two objectives is to find Warlock's gun in Lens' workshops and retrieve it for him.

After the conversation finishes, head towards the Lens workshop in Zalissya and enter it. Head straight forward towards the workbench and look to the left side to spot Warlock's rifle "Partner" lying against the wall. Bring it back to Warlock to complete the objective.

Bring Hamster Back to the Base (Optional)

The next task on the list for Warlock is bringing Hamster back to the base so he can share supplies with the survivors in Zalissya. Head towards the Emission shelter in Zalissya to encounter Hamster and his guard.

After a brief confrontation, players can either choose to threaten Hamster, which may lead to a fight with him, or this can be resolved peacefully by keeping Hamster alive. If you want Hamster to keep operating as Zalissya's vendor, go with the peaceful route here.

Talk to Hamster's bodyguard and ask how much he is paying him for protection. After a quick conversation, you'll need to pay the guard 6000 coupons , after which he'll head back to Zalissya, taking Hamster with him.

Find Mykolayich's Medical Kit to Help Lens (Optional)

Another NPC that you can optionally help is Mykolayich, who's looking after a critically wounded Lens. His medical supplies have gone missing, and he needs Skif to find them. This will aid in Lens getting back in shape and becoming active as a technician for the Zalissya base again.

After completing the conversation, the location of three Gaffer supply chests will be marked on the map. You'll need to visit the locations for all the chests in hopes of finding the medical kit for Mykolayich. Once the kit is found, return back to him to hand it over. He'll thank you for them and start treating Lens.

Taking Out Monolithian Scouts (Optional)

Right outside the Ward office, you'll find Slavko Pharmacist, who'll inform Skif that there's a group of Monolithian scouts standing above the hill. He'll urge you to take them out to avoid another attack from the Monolith.

This objective is quite simple as you'll need to traverse up the hill and simply take out the two Monolithian scouts located there. Once the scouts are taken care of, the objective will be marked as complete without needing to return to Slavko.

Track Down and Eliminate Uncle Lyonya

Now, you can finally do the main objective of the On the Edge side mission in Stalker 2 , locating and taking out Uncle Lyonya . Start by heading over to Uncle Lyonya's hut right outside Zalissya on the location marked on your map.

After reaching the hut, change the frequency of the radio inside to hear a conversation between Monolithian soldiers and Uncle Lyonya. After a brief moment, he'll arrive right outside the hut with Monolithian soldiers to attack Skif. Fend off the attack and eliminate Uncle Lyonya once and for all.

Loot his body afterward to recover Uncle Lyonya's PDA, which has an important message that you can listen to on your back to Zalissya. Talk to Gaffer and tell him that all the objectives are completed to finish the On the Edge side mission. You'll be rewarded with a SEVA suit that has PSI protection.

item.title: Skyrim: The 32 Best Heavy Armor Sets, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Heavy armor in Skyrim like Ancient Nord and Iron Armor is great for early-game tanky characters.
  • Ebony and Daedric armor sets are the most powerful in the game with high armor ratings.
  • Creation Club content adds unique armor sets like Golden Saint and Indoril Armor to enhance gameplay.

For every character, there's a perfect set of armor in The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim . If a player chooses to go down the tankier route and make a close-combat, heavy-damage Dragonborn, chances are they'll most likely invest perks in the heavy armor skill tree. Heavy armor is great for two-handed fighters who like to stay close up and personal and dish out a ton of damage while being able to sustain a lot as well. A player's stamina may be affected as a result, but most people won't mind as long as they can tank through most blows and swing their weapon with immense gusto to take out the many foes standing in their way.

The best Skyrim heavy armor will suit such character builds. Wearing a full set is also a great bonus, provided the player has unlocked the perks within the heavy armor skill tree that grants powerful boosts when wearing only heavy armor. There are many great Heavy Armor sets in Skyrim that players can invest in, with the vast majority of them doing a great job of negating most of the damage inflicted on the Dragonborn and letting them power through the battlefield in style.

Updated on December 27, 2024, by Gerardo Molina: The beauty of The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim is that there's a broad range of weapons, armor, and spells to choose from, so players have a lot of freedom when it comes to how they want to play the game. Some of the armors listed below can be obtained rather early in the game, while others will require players to invest a lot of time into improving their Smithing skills and getting the necessary ingredients, many of which are hard to come by. Then there's esthetics, as players might not want to trade off a great look in exchange for better protection. At the end of the day, it’s up to every Dragonborn’s preference.

32 Silver Armor

Part Of The Alternative Armors - Silver Creation Club

  • Perfect Armor Rating: 62
  • How To Get: Can be obtained during the "When the Cat's Away" quest inside Lund's Hut in the chest locked with a key

The Silver Armor is one of the best-looking heavy armor sets in the entire game. This armor is part of the Alternative Armors - Silver Creation Club content. While it doesn't have the best armor rating in the game, it does provide decent protection and has an overall appearance that is great.

It can be obtained by finding a couple of confession notes throughout Whiterun and then going to Lund's Hut.

Players should have honed their lockpicking skills at this point, as the armor is locked inside a chest at the end of Lund’s bed.

31 Madness Armor

Part Of The Saints & Seducers Creation Club

  • Armor Rating: 79.25
  • How To Get: Can be crafted after learning Madness Smithing by reading Evethra's Journal

The Madness Armor has a very peculiar look to it, as it features a giant humanoid face that covers the entirety of the chestplate area. This armor set is part of the Saints & Seducers Creation Club content and strangely enough, it resembles Ornstein’s armor from the Original Dark Souls —at least in a few design aspects and shades of yellow.

Players will be able to craft the Madness Armor after learning the Madness Smithing skill through Evethra’s Journal. With a decent armor rating, and an intimidating appearance, this armor is definitely worth the effort.

30 Ancient Nord Armor

A Decent Suit Of Armor That Looks Amazing

  • Armor Rating: 60
  • How To Get: Forelhost, Nordic Ruins, Aela The Huntress after marriage

The Ancient Nord Armor set is quite rare to find and complete. While most draugr will wear pieces of the set, most of them don't drop the armor as loot. Luckily, the armor is there more for its appearance than its utility.

One of the key ways of getting this armor set is to find it at Forelhost or purchase it from Aela The Huntress. Random pieces of it may be found all across Skyrim, typically in Nordic Ruins. It will certainly look nice on an armor stand. Despite being an okay-ish set, it has a high crafting requirement. It can only be made at the Skyforge with the Daedric Smithing perk.

29 Iron Armor (Regular And Banded)

Classic Armor That Is Useful In The Early Game

  • Armor Rating: 60 (regular), 63 (banded)
  • How To Get: Commonly found in random loot, merchants, as well as Shroudhearth Barrow, Riverwood, and Helgen

Iron Armor is just a copy of Ancient Nordic armor, but it's much more common and has its own distinct look. The regular type in particular is very easy to find early in the game, with some pieces available in Helgen as soon as the game starts.

There's also a banded version of iron armor, which is a bit better in terms of armor rating but still clearly a beginner's armor set in Skyrim . All in all, it's a set that the Dragonborn will likely wear when the game begins but will soon graduate out of. The bonus is that iron armor can be crafted without any Smithing perks or levels.

28 Ebony Spell Knight Armor

The Strongest Variant Of The Spell Knight Armor

  • Armor Rating: 62
  • How To Get: Finish the quest "Crypt of the Heart"

The best version of the Spell Knight Armor that players can find in the game is the one made of Ebony, as one would expect. This suit of armor has a very regal look that will serve as a piece of eye candy for players who love playing this game in first person.

Depending on the choices they make in the questline associated with this suit of armor, they'll get a version of the Ebony Spell Knight Armor with different enchantments. Regardless of what choice players make, there's no denying that they'll be rewarded with a great suit of armor that looks pretty amazing to boot.

27 Imperial Armor (Regular, Officer's Helmet, And Closed Helmet)

A Variant Of The Iron Armor With A Unique Look

  • Armor Rating: 60 (regular), 62 (officer's helmet), 63 (closed helmet)
  • How To Get: Helgen and when joining the Imperial Legion

Imperial Armor is another variant of iron armor. It has the same base armor rating of 60 but has a unique appearance to it. It also comes in three different types, depending on the kind of helmet the Dragonborn chooses to go for. The closed helmet type is the best variant, as it provides the most armor.

This is another extremely early-game heavy armor set in Skyrim . It won't serve the player well past a few levels, but it can be a nice starting armor for just about any character build that relies heavily on heavy armor. To craft it, the Steel Smithing perk is required, as well as level 20 of Smithing.

26 Iron Plate Armor

One Of The Iron Alternative Armors Added Via The Now-Defunct Creation Club

  • Armor Rating: 65
  • How To Get: Obtained via the quest "Brothers in Irons"

The Creation Club armor sets feature a unique quest that players must complete before getting their hands on some of Skyrim 's best heavy armor , and the Iron Plate Armor is one such set that players can acquire in the game. In terms of looks alone, this armor set is something players will love to wear if the base armor sets are getting too grating on the eyes.

The Iron Plate Armor may not last players for too long, but it is a perfectly serviceable suit of armor that is viable in the early- and mid-game. It's decent at absorbing damage and lets the Dragonborn look incredibly intimidating as they cleave their way through the many foes standing in their way.

25 Falmer Armor

Surprisingly Effective Armor Despite How Little It Covers

  • Armor Rating: 65
  • How To Get: Can either be found in the Mzinchaleft Depths or crafted with Chaurus Chitin

The Falmer Armor seems like a rather impractical suit of armor to wear while trying to avoid blows. It leaves the midriff of the Dragonborn wide open for attacks while also blocking their vision with one of the most impractical designs in the game.

However, for some reason, even this baffling design didn't prevent the Falmer Armor from having a respectable armor rating in the game. Of course, this armor is easily outclassed by most of the other heavy armor in Skyrim .

24 Wolf Armor

Amazing Looking Armor With Decent Protection

  • Armor Rating Without Shield: 72
  • HowTo Get: Eorlund Gray-Mane's shop (must join Companions first)

The Wolf Armor is a surprisingly cool set that can be seen on many of the members of the Companions upon joining them. Not many players may have noticed, but this armor set can also be bought from Eorlund Gray-Mane after they've completed the Proving Honor quest in the Companions faction.

Although this heavy armor set looks nice, it's not that strong in the long run and soon becomes obsolete in comparison to Dwarven armor for instance. That being said, it provides a nice base armor of 72 when a full set of it is worn.

23 Steel Armor

The Armor That Most Players Will Stick With In The Early Game

  • Armor Rating: 72
  • How To Get: Buy from merchants, loot from chests or bandits

Tied with the Wolf Armor, Steel Armor is a bit easier to find while adventuring in Skyrim. Most random loot and merchants will have steel armor, so players won't be having a hard time at all to find at least a few pieces of it here and there. It's a decent early-game choice as well, upgrading from iron armor.

To craft steel armor, level 20 of Smithing is required, as is the Steel Smithing perk.

22 Bonemold Armor

Causes Morrowind Flashbacks In The Best Way Possible

  • Armor Rating: 73
  • How To Get: Requires Dragonborn DLC, can be purchased from Glover Mallory at Raven Rock

The Bonemold Armor is another set introduced first in the Dragonborn DLC. Upon entering Raven Rock in particular, the player will spot it on local Redoran guards. Like the Chitin Heavy Armor, it's sold by Glover Mallory and worn occasionally by Reavers.

With the right level of Smithing, which in this case is only 15, the player can craft their own set with bone meal, Netch leather, and iron ingots. A full set has a fairly good armor rating of 73 and is still lackluster compared to many of the base game heavy armor sets found later in Skyrim.

21 Iron Spell Knight Armor

Added In The Game Via The Creation Club

  • Armor Rating: 76
  • How To Get: Found during the quest "Crypt of the Heart"

There's no denying that the armor added via the Creation Club looks amazing, and the Spell Knight Armor is a great example of the same. The quest involving this suit of armor may be pretty simple, but players won't mind as long as they get their hands on one of the best heavy armor sets in Skyrim .

The Iron Spell Knight Armor may be the weakest of the bunch, but don't let that take away from the impressive level of protection afforded by this set. Players who manage to get their hands on this gear early in the game will be using it for quite some time before a better set of heavy armor comes their way.

20 Dwarven Armor

Easy To Craft And Provides A High Armor Rating

  • Armor Rating: 78
  • How To Get: Commonly found in random loot, especially in Dwemer ruins like Nchuand-Zel

One of the more common heavy armor sets to find in Dwemer ruins, Dwarven Armor is also fairly easy to craft. The player will need to be level 30 in Smithing, with the Dwarven perk unlocked. The difficulty with crafting this armor set is that it requires Dwarven metal ingots, which need to be smelted from Dwarven metal scraps.

It's a nice mid-game heavy armor set in Skyrim to have but outlives its usefulness after a point. Nchuand-Zel is one of the best locations to find a full set if the player urgently requires one.

19 Dawnguard Heavy Armor

Amazing Looking Armor From The Dawnguard DLC

  • Armor Rating: 78
  • How To Get: Requires the Dawnguard DLC, received when joining the Dawnguard faction

The Dawnguard DLC also introduced a brand new armor set: the Dawnguard Heavy armor. If the player joins the vampire hunter faction, they'll be able to receive this armor upon joining. To get the helmet, however, it needs to be bought from Gunmar.

Much like other faction-related armor sets, this heavy armor can't be crafted from scratch. That being said, it can be upgraded using steel ingots.

18 Falmer Hardened Armor

A Tougher Version Of The Falmer Armor

  • Armor Rating: 78
  • How To Get: Commonly found in Dawnguard DLC, on high-level Falmers

Found in the Dawnguard DLC, this Falmer Hardened Armor is a weaker variant of the Falmer Heavy Armor. It looks entirely the same as its stronger version but has a significantly lower base armor rating. The armor can be often looted off of high-level Falmer enemies like Warmongers and Shadowmasters.

The pieces can't be crafted, but they can be upgraded with Chaurus chitin. The base armor rating for a full set is 78 points, which makes this heavy armor set kind of weak since it ranks so much lower than sets that are much easier to find all around Skyrim and earlier on in the game.

17 Improved Bonemold Armor

A Unique-Looking Armor That Is Great

  • Armor Rating: 79
  • How To Get: Read the Bonemold Formula note at the end of the Paid in Full quest to get the crafting recipe

The idea of using bone as armor might sound pretty harebrained, but logic doesn't necessarily need to apply in a fantasy world full of magic and dragons. So, it's not all that hard to see why the Bonemold Armor functions as a decent suit of heavy armor in the game.

If the base armor isn't good enough, there's an improved version of the same that can be acquired after completing a certain quest. The Improved Bonemold Armor set is pretty beefy and can tank many attacks, even if the component itself might not seem all that powerful.

16 Chitin Heavy Armor

One Of The Best-Looking Armor Sets In The Entire Game

  • Armor Rating: 87
  • How To Get: Requires Dragonborn DLC, reliably acquired after killing Vendil Severin during the quest Served Cold

Players who have the Dragonborn DLC will have access to this unique and cool Chitin Heavy Armor set, which is inspired by the Morag Tong light armor variant. It's a surprisingly lightweight set as well, making it a good heavy armor set in Skyrim.

The Chitin Heavy Armor set provides an armor rating of 87 when a full set is worn. It can be found all around Solstheim as loot, but Glover Mallory will also sell it over at Raven Rock. Reavers are the best target to loot a full set. With high enough Smithing, the player can also craft their own set with Netch leather, chitin plate, and corundum ingots.

15 Steel Plate Armor

A Powerful Version Of Steel Armor Unlocked In Later Levels

  • Armor Rating: 87
  • How To Get: Can be found as random loot or purchasable equipment. Can also be crafted

Steel Plate Armor is a pretty widespread piece of armor that players can easily get after reaching level 18 in Skyrim . It's a good mid-game armor to use unless players want to go for more unique and exotic variants.

A special thing to note about the Steel Plate Armor is that it can only be crafted if players have invested in light armor smithing. It might sound odd, but this is far from the only armor that receives this special treatment.

14 Ahzidal's Armor

Tough Armor With A Nord Design

  • Armor Rating: 87
  • How To Get: Obtained in Kolbjorn Barrow

Speaking of unique armor, a great set that players can use if they manage to obtain the same at a relevant level is Ahzidal's Armor . It's a custom set of Nord Armor with better stats that can carry players for a decently long time.

As a bonus, players who are trying to be Enchanters will be well-serviced by the ten bonus points bequeathed by this entire set. All in all, Ahzidal's Armor is a great heavy armor set, even though it outlives its usefulness a while before the late-game starts.

13 Blades Armor

Tough Armor Worn By The Legendary Blades

  • Armor Rating: 88
  • How To Get: Sky Haven Temple, inside the armory

Related of course to the Blades faction, which is joined during the main questline, the armor of the faction can't be crafted. That being said, finding it isn't very difficult, and there's one set location where the player can expect to discover it. It can also be upgraded, eventually.

When entering Sky Haven temple, the Blades Heavy Armor set is inside the armory room and can be looted from the chest . Steel ingots can be used to upgrade it, and with a shield, the armor rating is bumped significantly to 114.
